entry.title: Re: Can I deliver a custom theme to all subscribers of my...
entry.content:
I can provide a update on using a custom theme within a launchpad module (tested with build workzone instance - documentation based on old portal service).

Advantage: Provider Account Theme can be used in Subscribed Applications, without transporting/creation of themes in Subscriber Account (used via URL)

In a Multitenant Scenario (Should also work single tenant, little adjustments necessary there - but approuter required)

  1. Create Custom Theme in your Multitenant Provider Account
  2. Create UI Theme Designer Instance (technical name: theming - plan: standard)
  3. Create Service Key for that UI Theme Designer Instance
  4. Go to Subscriber Account
  5. Create a destination for example: theming-service
    TypeHTTP
    Proxy TypeInternet
    URLfrom Service Key (endpoints.runtime) for example: https://theming-runtime.cfapps.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com
    AuthenticationOAuth2ClientCredentials
    Client IDfrom Service Key (clientid)
    Client Secret from Service Key (clientsecret)
    Token Service URLfrom Service Key (uaa.url) but append "/oauth/token" for example:
    https://<subaccount>.authentication.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token
    Token Service URL TypeDedicated
  6. Configuration in xs-app.json of application router. Routes need to be added:
    This config will redirect theme request to your provider subaccount
{
    "source": "^/themes$", 
    "target": "/themeroot/v1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{ 
    "source": "^/themes/(.*)$",
    "target": "/themeroot/v1/$1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{
      "source": "^/comsapuitheming.runtime/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "theming-service"
}‚Äã

7.  Usage in LaunpadModule or directly in index.html(when approuter points directly to index.html of application)

When using in Launchpad Module it's important to use ui5LibraryUrl instead of ui5VersionNumber, otherwise it will not work! Site Settings documentation: Configuring Site Settings | SAP Help Portal

Relevant for setting the theme is: sap-ui-theme=<custom-theme-id>@/themes Reference: Setting Themes - Documentation - Demo Kit - SAPUI5 SDK

  • Example for Launchpad Module: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/cp.portal/site?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes#Shell-home
  • Standalone/direct access via index.html: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/<appid(fetchedfromManifestJson)/index.html?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports 2008: Cannot use linked parameter for...
entry.content: Thank you for your response. Your statement is correct: a single parameter maintains the same value for all records. However, this appears to be a misunderstanding of my implementation strategy. My goal is not to sort by the parameter's constant value itself, but to use the parameter as a conditional input to control the sorting logic for a large dataset. The sorting is applied to the data records, not the parameter. The core of our report architecture is as follows: Our main report is designed to call the Process_Info SQL stored procedure only once. This single call retrieves all the necessary data for three separate subreports. Each subreport requires a different sorting order for its specific business logic: Subreport 1: Requires chronological sorting (Chrono_DT). Subreport 2: Requires sorting by batch number (Batch_Number). Subreport 3: Requires sorting by a third unique key. The performance benefit is clear: Current, inefficient method: Each subreport connects to the database and calls the Process_Info stored procedure separately, resulting in three redundant database calls and slow execution. Desired, efficient method: The main report makes one call to the stored procedure. The dataset is cached, and each subreport accesses this cached data, applying its unique sorting without a new database call. The issue is that when a parameter is linked from the main report to a subreport, it is not available in the subreport's Group Expert to serve as the conditional variable for dynamic sorting. Our request is for a reliable method to use a linked variable or field to control the subreport's sorting on its cached data. This is a fundamental requirement for optimizing report performance by reducing database round-trips.

entry.title: Re: Sales based contract difference variable amount post...
entry.content: Use a Separate Condition for Variable Rent and define a non-valuation-relevant condition for variable rent (e.g., ZVAR). Configure it to calculate only the excess over the fixed rent threshold. This may require a custom calculation formula or enhancement via BAdI RECD_COND_CALC. You can store the threshold (‚Çπ10,000) as a reference value in the condition master or contract parameters. Use it in your calculation logic to compare against actual sales-based rent. With the BAdI suggested above, override standard percentage-based calculation. Continue posting actual sales via RE-FX sales interface or manual entry. This triggers the variable rent calculation each month.

entry.title: Re: Field InventoryStockType cannot be set for this opera...
entry.content:
From your Payload details, below are the Key observations

  • InventoryStockType = "02" ‚Üí This refers to Quality Inspection stock.
  • StorageLocation = "" ‚Üí No storage location provided.
  • GoodsMovementType = "101" ‚Üí Standard GR for production or purchase.
  • Batch and Manufacturing Order are provided ‚Üí Suggests GR against production order.

Please note even for QI stock, Storage Location is mandatory in most scenarios. SAP needs to know where to place the stock physically, even if it's under inspection. For QI stock to be posted, the Inspection Type (e.g., 01 for GR) must be active in the Material Master (QM view). Check if the material 000000000000001594 has an inspection type assigned for plant 02BP. Custom fields like YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI and YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI may have validation logic. Ensure /Date(0)/ for frozen expiry isn‚Äôt causing a rejection. Sticker number format of "55528-[]" might be failing validation if the system expects a specific format.

In order to fix this,

  • add a valid storage location in the payload for plant 02BP.
  • Go to material master QM View for material 1594 in plant 02BP. Ensure Inspection Type 01 is active and properly configured.
  • Ensure all custom date fields are valid and not defaulted to zero. If YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI is not applicable, consider omitting it or using a valid date.
  • If 55528-[] is not accepted, try a clean format like 55528 or 55528-01

entry.title: Re: I cant access to the cases
entry.content:
Dear User,

yesterday we had a general Access issue on SAP for Me which has been solved later at that day.

In general

To view or create support cases, your S-user ID must have specific permissions:

  • Display Cases
  • Display All Cases
  • Report Technical Problem
  • Send Cases to SAP
  • Close Cases
  • Display Cloud Data (for cloud-related cases)

These permissions must be granted by your company‚Äôs Super Administrator 

Please check if you have the required authorizations are assigned.  You can verify this in SAP for Me under: "My Profile" ‚Üí "Authorizations".

If this works fine you might also check Browser Cache

Sometimes, access problems are caused by:

  • Browser cache or cookies
  • Ad blockers or extensions interfering with the portal

Try:

  • Clearing your browser cache
  • Using a different browser (e.g., Chrome, Edge)
  • Opening SAP for Me in incognito/private mode

If this isn't solving the issue it might be necessary to open a case on SAP for Me Product in the Get Support App and report adding:

  • Your User ID
  • Any error might occur

Thank you and best wishes

SAP for Me Technical Support Team

entry.title: Re: Creating S-User ID's
entry.content:
Hi, you have to go to SAP for Me. There you open the menu "Manage Users and Authorizations"

In the upper right corner you find the button "Request User"

Fill out the three fields for Customer (your company), the User including Language and company e-mail adress and last but not least the Authorization Package for the user at SAP for me. 

 

Than hit the Submit button in the lower right corner and afterwards the user will receive an e-mail with the Info for the S-User. 

 

You can see than the S-User also in your S-User Management list.

Joule ÊîØÊåÅÂ§öÁßç‰∫§‰∫íÊ®°ÂºèÔºå‰ΩøÁî®Êà∑ËÉΩÂ§ü‰ª•Ëá™ÁÑ∂ËØ≠Ë®Ä‰∏éÁ≥ªÁªüËøõË°å‰∫íÂä®Ôºö

  • ‰ø°ÊÅØÂûã (Informational)ÔºöJoule Êèê‰æõÁÆÄÊ¥ÅÁöÑÂ∏ÆÂä©ÂÜÖÂÆπÊëòË¶ÅÔºåÊúâÊïàÂõûÁ≠îÁî®Êà∑ÁöÑËá™ÁÑ∂ËØ≠Ë®ÄÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÊÇ®ÂèØ‰ª•ËØ¢ÈóÆ‚Äú‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØÊó†Ë¥πÁî®ÈîÄÂîÆËÆ¢ÂçïÔºü‚ÄùÊàñ‚ÄúÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÈÖçÁΩÆÈááË¥≠ËÆ¢ÂçïÁöÑÁÅµÊ¥ªÂ∑•‰ΩúÊµÅÔºü‚Äù„ÄÇ
  • ÂØºËà™Âûã (Navigational)ÔºöJoule Êé®ËçêÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÔºåÂπ∂‰øÉËøõÊó†ÁºùÂØºËà™ÔºåÂ∏ÆÂä©Áî®Êà∑ÊâßË°å‰∏öÂä°ÊµÅÁ®ã„ÄÇSAP Cloud ERP ‰∏≠ÊúâË∂ÖËøá 500 ‰∏™ÂØºËà™Âú∫ÊôØÔºå‰æãÂ¶Ç‚ÄúÊàëÂú®Âì™‰∏™Â∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è‰∏≠ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÈááË¥≠ËÆ¢ÂçïÔºü‚Äù„ÄÇ
  • ‰∫ãÂä°Âûã (Transactional)ÔºöJoule Êèê‰æõÂÖ≥‰∫é‰∏öÂä°ÂØπË±°ÁöÑÊ∑±ÂÖ•‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÊó†ÈúÄÊâìÂºÄÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•Âú®ÂØπËØù‰∏≠Êü•ÁúãÂíåÊìç‰Ωú‰∏öÂä°ÂØπË±°ÔºåSAP Cloud ERP ‰∏≠ÊúâË∂ÖËøá 45 ‰∏™‰∫ãÂä°Âú∫ÊôØ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÊÇ®ÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ËØ¢ÈóÆ‚ÄúÊòæÁ§∫ÂèëË¥ßÊñπ‰∏∫ Intelli Corp ÁöÑÈîÄÂîÆËÆ¢Âçï‚Äù„ÄÇÂÆÉËøòÊîØÊåÅÂàõÂª∫Ê¥ûÂØüÂç°„ÄÅÊ£ÄÊü•ÈîÄÂîÆËÆ¢ÂçïÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÅÁª≠ËÆ¢ËøáÊúü‰ª∑Ê†ºÂíåÊü•ÁúãÊÉÖÂ¢ÉÁ≠âÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ
  • ÂàÜÊûêÂûã (Analytical) ÔºöÊú™Êù•ÔºåÁî®Êà∑Â∞ÜËÉΩÂ§üÊèêÂá∫ÂàÜÊûêÊÄßÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåJoule Â∞ÜÂà©Áî® SAP Analytics Cloud ‰∏≠ÁöÑ JustAsk Êèê‰æõÂàÜÊûêÊ¥ûÂØü„ÄÇ

entry.title: Re: AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @haungo 
Thank you for your enthusiasm!

I'm happy to inform you that there are no limitations with AI-Assisted Calculations concerning connection types. All imported SAC models are fully supported, and all live connections that are supported by Data Analyzer are also compatible with AI-Assisted Calculations, including SAP Datasphere, BW, and HANA.

Let me know if you have any more questions or need further details.
Best regards,
Esther

entry.title: Change lease contract issues
entry.content:
Hello all, 

I have two issue appear when I try to change the #lease contract in REFX.

Issue 1: I have contract start in 2022 and end in 2030 with clearing amount in current year for three year advance 344,000. In 2025, I want to let the contract ending in 2026 and the payment advance become 114,666 for one year rather than three years.

So, I change the general tab end date to 2026 and remove all future condition with modified current modification to 114,666 from 2025 till 2026. 

The result, in #REFX the depreciation flows for the asset till 2026 but when I go to the asset number in #AA module the depreciation till 2025

Issue 2: I made some of change in another lease contract  and I receive this error message ‚ÄúProfit Center has different values (6004/6000) for the posting date and due date.

Please let me know how I can solve both these are issue correctly 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management
entry.content:
1. Navigating Promotion Challenges 

Within the ever-evolving consumer products industry, Key Account Managers (KAMs) face relentless pressure to plan and execute promotions that both meet ambitious sales targets and strengthen customer relationships. Yet, many KAMs wrestle with cumbersome, fragmented tools‚Äîranging from complex legacy systems to basic spreadsheets‚Äîthat slow down promotion management and consume valuable time that could be spent building customer relationships and driving strategic growth. 

 

2. End-to-End Promotion Management Made Simple with SAP Revenue Growth Management 

SAP Revenue Growth Management (REVENUE GROWTH MANAGEMENT) resolves these challenges by delivering an integrated platform designed for KAMs to plan, create, and manage promotions more efficiently and transparently. Built specifically for the consumer products industry, SAP Revenue Growth Management centralizes promotion planning while enabling seamless integration with financial execution and demand planning systems, giving KAMs the visibility and agility they need to optimize promotion management and accelerate revenue growth.  

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management.  

 

3. Four Key Strengths of Promotion Capabilities in SAP Revenue Growth Management 

3.1. Streamlined and Configurable Promotion Creation   

Promotion creation is made effortless within SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

  • Effective Promotion Creation

Unlike complex trade promotion management systems that require extensive configuration, SAP Revenue Growth Management guides users through promotion creation step by step ‚Äî from defining promotion basics and product groups to trade spends and volume specifics. 

  • Adaptable to Your Business

KAMs can manage short-term and long-term promotions of products and categories with flexible spend types. Multiple spend types can be selected within a single promotion, all configurable to fit your unique business requirements. Promotions can also be saved as drafts, enabling collaboration with customers before finalization. 

 

This streamlined yet configurable promotion creation enables KAMs to spend more time engaging customers and optimizing trade strategies, rather than wrestling with spreadsheets or complicated software. 

 

 

3.2. Intuitive Promotion Copying and Editing: Aligned with KAM Workflows  

KAMs can benefit from a simple, user-friendly experience that takes just a few clicks to copy promotions. 

  • Intuitive Workflow to Copy and Adjust

KAMs can quickly copy promotions, singularly or using a multi-promotion selection from existing account plans and then adapt them to new contexts by editing various fields‚Äîsuch as editing products, dates, or trade spends‚Äîwithout losing the underlying structures. This approach mirrors KAMs' real-world habits, such as adjusting a 2025 holiday promotion for 2026. It not only significantly speeds up campaign rollout but also supports rapid scaling, re-use and adaptation of successful promotions. How can KAMs tell which promotions are the most successful ‚Äì the embedded analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management enable KAM‚Äôs to see performance KPI‚Äôs for individual promotions within their accounts.  

  • Flexible On-the-Fly Edits

A planned enhancement in Q1, 2026 will allow direct edits to copied promotions within the workflow UI, eliminating time-consuming navigation. KAMs will be able to make immediate tweaks to elements like trade spend types, reducing steps and boosting planning agility. 

 

By aligning with real-world KAM workflows and continuously evolving the user experience, SAP Revenue Growth Management supports both current needs and future efficiency gains.  

 

3.3. Customizable Approval Flows: Balancing Governance and Agility  

Promotion approvals can be a significant bottleneck, especially in organizations with layered hierarchies or robust financial controls. SAP Revenue Growth Management leverages SAP Business Process Automation (BPA) to create approval flows that can be tailored precisely: 

  • Flexible, Value-Based Rules

Approval workflows can be customized to your organizational requirements. For example, implement automatic approval for promotions below a certain threshold (e.g., $100K), allowing smaller promotions to proceed swiftly while routing higher-value ones for additional review. KAMs can add comments when sending promotions for review.  

  • Balancing Compliance and Operational Efficiency

This process integrates key roles such as KAMs, sales managers, and trade finance teams into a streamlined, transparent workflow. It strikes a balance between governance and agility, enabling KAMs to submit plans with confidence while ensuring stakeholders are engaged appropriately.  

 

4. Co-Innovation: Driving Promotion Excellence Together 

SAP Revenue Growth Management is evolving, and we invite forward-thinking users like you to join our co-innovation. 

Collaborate with us on these initiatives‚Äîand bring your ideas to life. 

  • Overlapping Promotions: Enable the creation of more than one promotion for the same products within the same or overlapping periods. 
  • Sell-Out Promotions Planning: Plan promotions that focus on creating consumer demand and drive products from retailers' shelves to end consumers. 
  • Planning with Multiple Units of Measure (UoMs): Plan promotions with different units of measure for products and visualize their impact on KPIs. 

Contact RGM_Engage@sap.com today to collaborate and keep your competitive edge in the consumer products market. 

 

More Information

Documentation on SAP Help Portal

Topic Page for SAP Revenue Growth Management

  • Unlocking Trade Spend Control Efficiency with Funds Management in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Decoding Promotional Success: Embedded Analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Introducing Calendar View in SAP Revenue Growth Management: A Visual Leap for Strategic Planning
  • Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs Account Plan
  • Elevate Your Promotion Strategy: Baseline Management with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
  • Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management

entry.title: Lessons Learned: Fetching Learning History from SuccessFactors LMS Using OData APIs
entry.content:
Introduction

When integrating SAP SuccessFactors LMS (Learning Management System) with downstream systems, one common requirement is to extract Learning History data ‚Äî i.e., the courses a user has completed.

In this blogpost, I‚Äôll share my journey of exploring the OData V4 APIs provided by SuccessFactors LMS, the challenges I faced, and how I managed to make it work with SAP Cloud Integration (CPI).

This article is especially useful if you are:

  • Trying to pull learning history records from LMS

  • Wondering why your API calls return errors like ‚Äúmissing search criteria filter information‚Äù

  • Looking for ready-to-use Groovy code to loop through users in CPI

Exploring the LMS OData V4 APIs

The base metadata endpoint looks like this:

https://<tenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/userlearning-service/v1/$metadata

From the metadata, we can see entity sets like LearningHistories and learninghistorys.

üëâ A valid API call to fetch a user‚Äôs learning history looks like this:

GET https://<tenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys?
$filter=criteria/targetUserID eq 'STUDENT001'

And the response returns details such as:

  • componentID ‚Üí Course ID

  • title ‚Üí Course Title

  • completionDate ‚Üí Date Completed

  • status ‚Üí Completion Status

Challenges I Faced

During implementation, several challenges came up:

  1. Malformed URI errors ‚Äî caused by wrong resource paths in the CPI SuccessFactors adapter.

  2. 404 Not Found ‚Äî when calling invalid entity sets (e.g., /LearningEvent is not supported in V4).

  3. ‚ÄúMissing search criteria filter information‚Äù ‚Äî occurs if you don‚Äôt pass criteria/targetUserID.

  4. Single-user limitation ‚Äî the API requires a targetUserID for every call, so bulk retrieval is not supported directly.

These were showstoppers until we aligned on the correct way to filter.

Solution: Fetching Learning History

‚úÖ The working query pattern is:

/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys?
$filter=criteria/targetUserID eq 'STUDENT001'

This means:

  • We must pass a user ID (student ID) every time.

  • To fetch data for multiple users, we need to loop through the list of student IDs.

Building It in SAP CPI

Here‚Äôs how you can design the iFlow:

  1. Get list of users ‚Äì call /Students API or have a predefined list.

  2. Loop through users ‚Äì in CPI, use a Splitter or Groovy script.

  3. Call LearningHistory API ‚Äì pass each student ID dynamically.

  4. Collect responses ‚Äì aggregate all learning history data.

  5. Filter & send downstream ‚Äì only send completed courses or specific items (e.g., MAIR Code of Conduct).

Groovy Snippet: Looping Through Student IDs

Here‚Äôs a ready-to-use script you can copy-paste into CPI.

 

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.json.*
import java.net.*
import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets

Message processData(Message message) {

    // 1. List of Student IDs (replace with dynamic input if needed)
    def studentIds = ["STUDENT001", "STUDENT002", "STUDENT003"]

    // 2. LMS LearningHistory API base URL
    def baseUrl = "https://<yourtenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys"

    // 3. Get OAuth token from exchange property (set earlier in the flow)
    def accessToken = message.getProperty("OAuthToken")
    if (!accessToken) {
        throw new Exception("OAuth token not found. Please configure security flow correctly.")
    }

    def results = []

    studentIds.each { studentId ->
        try {
            // Build URL with criteria filter
            def query = "?$filter=" + URLEncoder.encode("criteria/targetUserID eq '${studentId}'", StandardCharsets.UTF_8.toString())
            def url = new URL(baseUrl + query)

            def connection = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection()
            connection.setRequestMethod("GET")
            connection.setRequestProperty("Authorization", "Bearer " + accessToken)
            connection.setRequestProperty("Accept", "application/json")

            def responseText = connection.inputStream.getText("UTF-8")
            def responseJson = new JsonSlurper().parseText(responseText)

            results.add([studentId: studentId, records: responseJson.value])

            connection.disconnect()
        } catch (Exception e) {
            results.add([studentId: studentId, error: e.message])
        }
    }

    // Return consolidated result
    message.setBody(JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(results)))
    return message
}

‚úÖ Example Output

 

[
  {
    "studentId": "STUDENT001",
    "records": [
      { "componentID": "COURSE101", "title": "Data Privacy", "status": "Complete" }
    ]
  },
  {
    "studentId": "STUDENT002",
    "records": []
  }
]

Key Learnings

  • The LearningHistory API works only when you pass criteria/targetUserID.

  • Bulk extraction is not supported directly ‚Äî looping is required.

  • You can optimize with CPI Splitter/Multicast for larger user volumes.

  • Always check the $metadata endpoint to confirm entity names before calling.

References That Helped

  1. SuccessFactors Integrations Beginner‚Äôs Guide: Exploring Learning Management
    (Official SAP blogpost explaining LMS OData services in detail)

  2. How to Integrate SuccessFactors LMS Module using Oracle Integration Cloud
    (A community blog showing similar challenges when integrating LMS APIs with another middleware)

These reinforced the idea that while LMS OData APIs are powerful, they also come with design constraints that integrators must handle.

Conclusion

Fetching Learning History from SuccessFactors LMS is possible via OData APIs, but you need to understand the mandatory filter requirements and handle the per-user limitation with looping.

With the right design in SAP CPI ‚Äî and a bit of Groovy scripting ‚Äî you can build a robust integration that delivers exactly what business needs.

entry.title: Re: Need Help
entry.content:
Leverage Key User Extensibility to add a custom field for Actual Weight at the delivery item level or billing item level. This field can be populated by your macro or via API integration from the warehouse system.

If the macro recalculates weights and quantities, use BAdI SD_DELIVERY_ITEM_MODIFY or API /API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV to update the delivery item quantities or weights. Ensure the adjusted weights are stored in a field that can be used in invoice output.

Modify the billing document output form to display the actual weight per item and show the total actual pallet weight. Use the custom field or adjusted delivery data as the source.

If your macro runs outside SAP (e.g., Excel or MES), consider building a middleware integration to push adjusted weights into SAP. Or use SAP AppGyver / UI5 app to allow warehouse users to enter actual weights directly.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Re: How to add new applications for users
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Thanks for reaching out.

Regarding assigning new applications after upgrades to CB users, please kindly refer to below steps.

Firstly, you can check for the Business Catalog(s) for the required applications in Fiori Apps Library:

  1. Login Fiori Apps Library.
  2. Select All apps for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  3. Click All Apps.
  4. Input the required application name in search bar.
  5. Select the searched out application name.
  6. Navigate to IMPLEMENTATION INFORMATION tab.
  7. Open Configuration subtab, under Business Catalog(s) you can see the Business Catalog(s) for the application.

After checked the Business Catalogs for the required applications, you can add these Business Catalogs to a Business Role that is assigned to the CB user to whom you would like he/she to see the applications in system,  and then the user can access to the required applications.

Hope this helps clarify the issue.

Best regards,

Jannie

entry.title: Re: NOW RELEASED: Upload and work with external files in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation
entry.content:
@lschenck : in general the storage of the external files on BTP SMD gives you a seamless integration of the file to the internal SAP Cloud ALM document. The internal document stores the meta data and controls the versioning of the external file (in two weeks we will display also the external file version in our internal document). The external files shall be just edited through the internal document, including performing status changes, approval procedures and workflows as well as future authorization concepts for internal and thus also external documents. This prevents from unintended edits direclty to the files or their deletion (it is always treated as one object). Compared to this, the representation of the external file as a reference link is very loose without any control from SAP Cloud ALM side.  

Regarding the storage space: 
The storage of 8GB is dedicated to the internal document content, while the external files are allocating the space of BTP DMS. Here the BTP Document management service is used, which has its own price based on your package.

entry.title: JCo Parameters
entry.content:
Hello together,

we have connected our SAP ECC System with our WACOS Warehouse Management System via Direkt RFC with SAP JCO. 

After switching our quality System to SAP ECS Cloud we had the Problem that the rfc queue in sm58 was only precessing one call every few minutes. 

 

We changed the following parameter jco.server.connection_count from 1 to 40. After that the Performance of processing RFC Calls was much better than before. 

But we are not sure if it's enogh to change the parameter up to 40 or if we must rise it higher.

In normal Business we are packing our parcels at nearly 20-25 packing stations. Each parcel needs 2 RFC Calls. In the logging we saw that each call creates up to 5 Connections at one time. So is it ok when we rise the parameter up to 100 oder higher? Or will we get some Problems then?

These parameters were changed additionally:

jco.destination.peak_limit=50

jco.destination.pool_capacity=40

jco.destination.expiration_time=900000

jco.destination.expiration_period=600000

jco.destination.max_get_time=60000 

Does anybody have experience with that?

Thanks in advance!

Gunther

entry.title: Welcome "Requirement Approver" in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALM now includes a dedicated ‚ÄúRequirement Approver‚Äù role. A long-requested feature that brings clarity, control, and structure to the requirement approval process in your projects.

Background ‚Äì How It Was Before

Until now, any project member could approve requirements in SAP Cloud ALM. This meant there was no clear responsibility or structure around who should approve a requirement, leading to confusion, lack of accountability, and inconsistency in project delivery.

Many of you shared the same feedback:

‚ÄúWe need a way to define who is actually allowed to approve requirements.‚Äù

And we heard you.

 

 

 What's Changed?

With the new update, you can now assign a specific ‚ÄúRequirement Approver‚Äù role to team members within your project. Once this is done:

  • Only users assigned to this role can approve requirements.
  • Project Administrators will always retain the right to approve.
  • If no approvers are assigned, things work like before, that is any user with the right permission can approve. So things work as usual if you want the current behaviour to continue.
  • Users in the ‚ÄúRequirement Approver‚Äù role will receive a notification when a requirement is set to Ready for Approval making sure nothing slips through the cracks.

 

How It Works ‚Äì At a Glance

  1. Assign the Role: In your project team settings, assign one or more users to the new ‚ÄúRequirement Approver‚Äù role.
  2. Control Approval: From that point on, only these users (and Project Admins) will be able to approve requirements.
  3. Stay Informed: When a requirement is marked as Ready for Approval, approvers receive a notification with details and a link to review and approve directly.

Note: This applies to projects without workflow subscriptions. If your project uses workflows, those rules still apply.

 

Why This Matters

This change adds structure and clarity to the requirement lifecycle in your SAP Cloud ALM projects:

  • You now have better governance over who can approve.
  • It improves project accountability and avoids unintentional approvals.
  • It supports a cleaner, more organized approval process‚Äîespecially in large teams or complex implementations.

 

What You Need to Do

  • Head over to your project team settings.
  • Assign the ‚ÄúRequirement Approver‚Äù role to users who should have the authority.
  • You're all set! Your approval process is now more streamlined and secure.

 

This small but powerful update brings real value to teams using SAP Cloud ALM. It helps everyone stay aligned, ensures only the right people approve critical requirements, and brings more structure across all task types.

We hope you find this helpful and as always, keep the feedback coming!

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Time Travel and Data Retention capab...
entry.content: No, the service includes backups for disaster recovery (managed by SAP), but if you delete something, it's gone. There is no 'Trash' folder or similar feature where you can undo deletions. You can create "backups" using export or datasphere-cli, but it is not integrated and it is not user friedly option as "undo"

entry.title: Local OData API Access in Edge Integration Cell Runtimes
entry.content:
With the usage of Edge Integration Cell runtime, a mixture of Cloud and On-Prem solutions is utilized in some aspects. One of these aspects is calling the OData APIs. When the clients try to make such API calls in the Edge Integration Cell runtimes, their queries are bypassing the cloud to reach the corresponding edge cluster.  As long as the connectivity to the cloud is available, these scenarios will work properly. However, in case the cloud connection is broken, the clients will not be able to use such APIs and consequently will not be able to monitor their edge runtime properly.

To tackle the above problem, a new feature is added to the cloud integration for the edge-enabled runtimes by which the clients are able to call a subset of monitoring APIs without the intervention of cloud, so called "Local API Access". 

In this Blog I will try to address this topic and how can this feature be used by the clients properly. We will see how can we configure the edge clusters to enable the Local Access(API Plan). I will also provide the information on how the APIs can be called and finally will provide a list of the APIs which are currently exposed locally. 

 

Configure Cluster to Support API Plan

The first step for using Local API Access, is activating the API Plan support to the cluster. This can be done using the ELMO UI. By selecting the desired cluster and modify the configuration, you will see the new settings available also for the API Plan: API Virtual Host and API Virtual Host Key Alias. These settings are also available upon on-boarding of a new edge node. This is also depicted in the following picture. 

  • API Virtual Host can be any preferred valid domain name of your choice. In case this is supposed to be exposed to internet, then this also needs to be registered in the DNS as well. 
  • API Virtual Host Key Alias is similar to what you have in the default virtual host. This is the alias of keystore entry which contains a valid key and is stored on the corresponding edge runtime. 

 

Configuring API Plan Support in ELMO UI

 

Once these settings are applied, the corresponding new resources will be created in the K8s cluster including a new Gateway which is created for directly accessing the APIs. The Edge runtime will now be able to handle local API calls. 

 

Required Authentication Setups for calling APIs

At the time of writing this Blog and in the initial increment of this feature only the certificate-based authentication is supported for local API Accesses. As the clients are making calls against the new API Virtual Host directly and this is handled by HTTPS connectivity, an MTLS connectivity is required to be established to the cluster. The clients are required to provide the public and private keys for a TLS Connection. The required service key(needed for the public and private keys) can be achieved using the BTP Account Cockpit in cloud integration. You need to create(or use the existing one) a new API Service instance for accessing APIs as followed

  • Service: Process Integration Runtime 
  • Plan: Process Integration API access

Service Instance Creation for API Plan

 

 

You then need to create a new service key (or use the existing one) in the above Service Instance using the Certificate client type. Once this is created successfully use the created credentials for the TLS connection. You can use the certificate chain as well as the key entry which are provided there in the newly created credential.

Creating new Certificate Key for API Plan Service Instance

Accessing Certificate and Private Key for calling Local APIs

 You need to consider that accessing certain APIs requires also special permissions(Roles) and for having proper access to the APIs you need to assign all the required Roles to your service instance at the time of creation too. 

You can use the certificates and key in the above in order to establish a TLS connection to your cluster and calling the desired API with your favorite REST Client. For simplicity, you can also keep the above data in two different files and simply refer to them in your REST Clients e.g. Curl.

 

Calling the APIs 

So far, we have seen how to activate the API plan on the edge runtimes and also how to properly setup the required athentication parameters to make the API Calls. We are now good to see how the actual API call works. For this, you need add a /local prefix to your defined Virtual Host followed by /ap1/v1/<Desired Endpoint>. Adding the /local prefix here is important, as this will be used to distinguish the local API calls from the calls via cloud. If you do not use the /local prefix then a 401 Unauthorized error would be thrown, even if you use a valid credential. 

Here is an example of the API Call: https://<YOUR_DEFINED_VIRTUAL_HOST>/local/api/v1/<DESIRED_ENDPOINT_TO_BE_CALLED>

  • <YOUR_DEFINED_VIRTUAL_HOST>: This is the Virtual Host that you have defined for your your edge Runtime in ELMO UI
  • /local: This prefix is required to be added to the endpoint call in order to distinguish the local calls from the calls via cloud
  • /api/v1: Conventially used for calling APIs, similar to the calls over the cloud
  • /<DESIRED_ENDPOINT_TO_BE_CALLED>: The desired endpoint which is supposed to be called. This is similar to the calls over cloud.
    • e.g. MessageProcessingLogs

As mentioned earlier, for the initial increment of this feature only a subset of the APIs are exposed for local access, here is the list these APIs:

  • /MessageProcessingLogs
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /MessageProcessingLogErrorInformations
      • /MessageProcessingLogAttachments
      • /MessageProcessingLogCustomHeaderProperties
  • /MessageStoreEntries
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /MessageStoreEntryProperties
      • /MessageStoreEntryAttachments
      • /MessageStoreEntryAttachmentProperties
  • /DataStores
    • Including sub-entities 
      • /DataStoreEntries
  • /JmsBrokers
  • /Variables

The complete definition and usage of the APIs is defined in the official SAP API documentation page . The usage of the APIs should be adapted according to the above explanations for the local accesses. Please consider that the APIs are only exposed for the Monitoring purposes. This means, that only Get REST API calls are allowed to be done locally and none of the other methods would be available.

 

Future Improvements

Given the above information about the usage of the Local API Access by the initial increment, there are some enhancements on the road map for the future as followed.

  • Supporting the OAuth2 mechanism for the Authorization
    • This will provide more flexibility for the clients to use the OAuth2 flow similar to the cloud to call the APIs locally
  • Relaxing the /local prefix addition to the API path
    • With this change the clients will not require any more to add the /local prefix to the API URLs anymore. After adding this enhancement, both URLs would be supported either with or without /local prefix.

entry.title: Re: Packing Process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (...
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can absolutely support this using Handling Units (HUs) and Packaging Specifications. SAP uses Handling Units (HUs) to manage packaging structures. Your scenario would be modeled as

  • Base product ‚Üí packed into sacks (first-level HU)
  • Sacks ‚Üí packed onto pallets (second-level HU)

This is called multi-level HU packaging, and it is supported in both delivery processing and warehouse management.

In order to achieve your requirement, do the following: -

Use the app: Manage Product Master Data from which, create materials for Sack and Pallet. For both these, you can consider material type VERP. Assign packaging material group, dimensions, and weight

Use the app: Manage Packaging Specifications. Here, define how many base units go into a sack. Define how many sacks go onto a pallet and set validity dates, condition records, and HU templates

Next, use the app: Manage Your Solution ‚Üí SSCUI. Activate HU management for relevant storage locations.

Use Delivery-Based Packing with the app: Change Outbound Delivery. Use automatic packing based on packaging specs, or manually pack using Pack function in delivery

entry.title: Supporting Digital Transformation with SAP Digital Payments
entry.content:
Supporting Digital Transformation in Consumer Industries with SAP Digital Payments

In the digital age, consumer industry customers have been increasingly tasked with overhauling their digital payments strategy, business processes, and supporting software. Offering flexible payment options for their customers is no longer a ‚Äúnice to have‚Äù but is critical in achieving a best-in-class customer experience. SAP supports customers in their journey to become market leaders by offering a fully integrated digital payments solution catered to the needs of the consumer industry.

Introducing SAP Digital Payments

SAP Digital Payments is a cloud-based integration solution running on SAP‚Äôs Business Technology Platform (BTP) that enables the processing of electronic payments in core business applications. Through the use of API‚Äôs it has out-of-the-box integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and supports card registration, payment authorization, refunds, settlement, and payment advice. Through the adoption of clean-core concepts, SAP Digital Payments enables customers to quickly adapt to changes in the market as well as their own corporate strategies and initiatives.

Security and Compliance

Failing to secure sensitive data such as credit card information can be catastrophic to a business. In addition to providing end-to-end encrypted processing of payment card transactions across systems, SAP Digital Payments eliminates the need for storage and processing of sensitive credit card details, which provides a higher degree of security and reduces PCI auditing efforts. The solution is compliant according to the latest Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS 4.0) which enables end-user trust that their information is protected from unauthorized access and data breaches.

Clean Core

One of the key value drivers of the solution is that it supports the clean core concept by decoupling integration with PSPs. De-coupling has several benefits. For starters, it allows a customer to support more than one PSP at a time or easily switch from one PSP to another with nothing more than a configuration update. Secondly, it eliminates the need to add custom code (whether customer developed, or partner supplied) in the core Cloud ERP system. This makes future upgrade easier, faster, and less costly. Finally, it enables customers to adopt payment card industry best practices with minimal effort and out-of-the-box support.

RISE with SAP

Did you know SAP Digital Payments is a required solution for RISE customers processing credit cards in their S/4HANA system? When customers process payment card transactions on SAP operated infrastructure, PCI-DSS requirements become applicable to SAP. As such, SAP must provide a mechanism for customers to follow best practices and secure sensitive credit card information. SAP Digital Payments is critical (in fact contractually mandatory) in achieving this.

 Key Take Away

As a cloud-based solution, adoption of SAP Digital Payments is critical for customers in their cloud journey and digital transformation initiatives. It is SAP‚Äôs strategic direction for processing of payment cards and integrating with Payment Service Providers. Consumer Industry customers benefit from its innovative approach to securing sensitive payment transactions and consumer data.

entry.title: Re: RPCNETN0 page down button not working in subscreen
entry.content:
In batch input, page down and page up are like pressing enter, it's explained in the SAP note 11788 - Batch input, variable step loop or table control - SAP for Me.

The workaround is to find a button or menu which is equivalent to scrolling.

There's often a button to position at a given line (Find, etc.)

If there's none, you need to do a modification of standard to provide a function code to do this positioning and use it via Batch input.

entry.title: Re: Passing multiple Values in Input Parameter from SAC t...
entry.content:
Hello,

the problem is that the views in Datasphere are SQL views that accept only a single value input parameter.

While the analytic model is a column view (more similar to a calcualtion view) 

=> in fact in recent releases we can manage multiple value variables in model but only for restricted measures and we can define a multi-value source variable to be mapped to view input parameter.

I add this inprovement request to HANA Cloud database.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/356660

After this is unlocked we can ask another for Datasphere itself.

 

Edit: please upvote this request, it requires 10 upvote it will be "acknowleged".
